channel.title: Lone Pine|Inyo County|California|United States on Roadsign Pictures
channel.description: Recent content in Lone Pine|Inyo County|California|United States on Roadsign Pictures

item.title: US-395 North at CA-136 East
item.description: US-395 North at CA-136 East on the south side of Lone Pine. CA-136 heads east across the north and east edges of dry Owens Lake to CA-190 junction.

item.title: US-395 North at CA-136 (To CA-190)
item.description: US-395 north at CA-136 north to CA-190. Use CA-136 east for Death Valley. The logo at the bottom of the sign, with the number 20 written on it, is for the Eastern Sierra Scenic Byway. Site number 20 refers to the Highest to Lowest and Desert’s Edge interpretive site.

item.title: US-395 North Approaching CA-136
item.description: US-395 north approaching CA-136 east to Death Valley.

item.title: US-395 South - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on US-395 south. Distance to CA-190 - Olancha Jct., Coso Jct., and Los Angeles.

item.title: US-395 South at CA-136
item.description: US-395 south at CA-136 east to Keeler and Death Valley.

item.title: US-395 South Approaching CA-136
item.description: US-395 south approaching CA-136 junction. Use CA-136 east to Death Valley.

item.title: Distance Marker on CA-136 East
item.description: CA-136 east to Keeler, Death Valley Museum, and Death Valley Junction.

item.title: End CA-136 West at US-395
item.description: Western end of CA-136 at US-395 to Bishop and Los Angeles. Above is a sunrise over Mt. Whitney.
